image.altText: The back of a young boy's head, looking toward a teacher at the front of a classroom.

props.synopsis: School principals suffer the worst levels of physical violence, threats and bullying in the history of a long-running national survey.

title.children: 'I've got to wear a body camera like police do': Exasperated teachers sick of helicopter parents as school violence surges

image.altText: A profile image of Victorian Opposition Leader John Pesutto, cropped tightly around his face

props.synopsis: Politicians complaining about the media usually have as much luck as sailors complaining about the weather. But that hasn't stopped Victorian Opposition Leader John Pesutto.

title.children: In a week where Victoria’s government was in the firing line, it was the opposition leader feeling the heat

image.altText: David Cameron in a navy suit.

props.synopsis: British Foreign Secretary David Cameron warns a Chinese blockade of Taiwan would cripple the global economy as he asks Israel to show restraint in Rafah.

title.children: 'Global dashboard flashing red': Former British PM's stark warning of impending conflict

image.altText: A split image shows a black and white portrait of a middle aged man and a small passenger plane

props.synopsis: It was supposed to be an adventurous day-trip deep into New Zealand's rugged Southern Alps, but on February 12, 1962, the tourists on board the dragonfly never came home.

title.children: Searching NZ's 'Bermuda Triangle' for the missing dragonfly plane and its Australian passengers

image.altText: A submarine moves through calm waters

props.synopsis: Almost $5 billion will go to British industry in the next decade to help design and build key parts of Australia's future nuclear-powered submarine fleet that will be constructed in Adelaide.

title.children: China threat justifies AUKUS spend, UK says, as Australia unveils $5b package for British industry

image.altText: A composite image of two male politicians

props.synopsis: How well ambassador Kevin Rudd would go if there were another Trump administration is unknowable, but the bigger question is how the Albanese government would manage it, writes Michelle Grattan.

title.children: Would the Australian alliance with America survive another Trump presidency?

image.altText: Anthony Albanese walks out of a church after a Good Friday service.

props.synopsis: An independent review into protecting LGBT staff and students at religious schools is now complete, but the government's own plans are no clearer.

title.children: Coalition signals sympathy with faith groups over religious schools review

image.altText: Jack Higgins kicks a goal from the boundary line against Magpies.

props.synopsis: Jack Higgins plays down the controversy surrounding his crucial goal in St Kilda's 15-point won over defending premiers Collingwood at the MCG.

title.children: 'I was in the Monash Uni car park': Higgins reacts to contentious goal in Saints' win over Magpies

image.altText: the exterior of a white apartment building

props.synopsis: Netstrata managing director Stephen Brell stands aside as the president of the NSW industry peak body in the wake of an ABC investigation into his firm.

title.children: Netstrata chief stands aside from peak body, company apologises after ABC report reveals excessive fees

image.altText: A woman with her mouth scribbled out and eyes blurred.

props.synopsis: Sophie* came to Australia to pursue a PhD but when her relationship turned violent she felt like she had nowhere to go.

title.children: Being in a foreign country, Sophie didn't know where to go when she left her violent relationship

image.altText: A graphic of keli Lane wearing a jacket with barbed wires behind her and a building

props.synopsis: The judge on Keli Lane's trial has since said her case was "circumstantial", but the recent legislation will likely keep her behind bars.

title.children: Convicted baby killer Keli Lane is making a bid for freedom, but a 'no body, no parole' law will affect her chances

image.altText: The Charging Bull statue in New York's financial district

props.synopsis: The Australian share market looks set for a subdued Friday, even as Wall Street's main indices set fresh records, and Reddit debuts on the market with a massive share price jump. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX set for cautious start despite fresh record on Wall St as Dow Jones nears 40,000 points

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Swiss central bank kicks off rate cuts
Apple shares savaged amid anti-trust lawsuit
Reddit surges on share market debut

image.altText: Reddit is seen on screens on the New York Stock Exchange trading floor.

props.synopsis: Reddit soars in its Wall Street debut as investors push the value of the company close to $US9 billion ($13.7 billion) seconds after it began trading on the New York Stock Exchange.

title.children: Reddit, the self-anointed 'front page of the internet', soars in Wall Street debut

image.altText: Two women in 1920s costumes walk side by side along a beach, chatting and smiling.

props.synopsis: Olivia Colman and Jessie Buckley star in this historical dramedy about 'unruly women' that delivers a masterclass in imaginative swearing.

title.children: Olivia Colman stars in historical dramedy that celebrates unruly women — and spectacular swearing

image.altText: A selfie of a woman in a light blue singlet top and blue shorts smiling with her arm outstretched to take the photo.

props.synopsis: We spoke with women who run about what they love about it and the kind of choices they make to help themselves feel safer when running.

title.children: Women on why they love to run, despite the fear that can come with it

image.altText: Logging, firearm, salmon composite image.

props.synopsis: No matter who wins this weekend's Tasmanian state election, it'll be more of the same in many ways. Here are some key policies where it is hard to tell the Liberals and Labor apart.

title.children: No matter which major party forms government in Tasmania, there are some things they've both promised

props.synopsis: Are you across this week's news headlines? Put yourself to the test.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Donald Trump's jab, a miracle platypus, and another royal controversy

image.altText: Rainbow flag

props.synopsis: Advocacy group Equality Australia calls the move a "historic step", paying tribute to trailblazing 78ers who took to the streets in protest to make change for the LGBTQ+ community.

title.children: 'We will protect you': NSW bans gay conversion therapy after marathon parliamentary debate

image.altText: Jane Hume in a white suit at a press conference.

props.synopsis: A new national women's Liberal network quietly launches to a small crowd at Parliament House, more than a year after it was recommended by a party review of the 2022 election loss.

title.children: Liberals quietly launch women's network that was promised after election defeat

image.altText: a composite image of a lorikeet, miner and magpie

props.synopsis: Last October, 60,000 people spent at least 20 minutes outside to identify the country's bird species and submit their tallies into the Aussie Bird Count app.

title.children: Lorikeet, miner or magpie — what is Australia's most commonly spotted bird?

image.altText: A visualisation of an agrihood - a neighbourhood built around both housing and farming.

props.synopsis: Ever wanted to quit the city and run away to start a farm? Welcome to the agrihood, where you can have town living in a rural setting.

title.children: Developer looking to merging homes, farming into 'agrihoods' to ease food, housing pressures

image.altText: Princess Kate smiles wearing a red blazer.

props.synopsis: Sir Keir Starmer, the man widely touted to become Britain's next prime minister, urges people to "butt out" and leave Kate Middleton alone, amid wild speculation about her health.

title.children: 'Butt out': Man touted to be Britain's next PM wants wild speculation about Princess Kate's health to end

image.altText: Emeriates airliner in flight

props.synopsis: It's alleged Mohamed Ahmed Omer secretly withdrew sponsorship for his then-wife's partner visa before booking a trip overseas. He allegedly returned with the couple's children, leaving the woman stranded and unable to return to Australia for almost two years.

title.children: Melbourne man on trial for exit trafficking after allegedly leaving wife stranded overseas without passport

image.altText: Surgeons look down in an operating theatre

props.synopsis: Doctors in Boston implant a pig kidney into a 62-year-old patient, the latest experiment in the quest to use animal organs in humans.

title.children: Surgeons transplant a gene-edited pig kidney into a living patient for the first time

image.altText: Vonette Mead smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: An integrity expert says a Liberal candidate in Tasmania's state election acted "inappropriately" after her construction company was found to have put in a tender for a council project, while she was deputy mayor of the council.

title.children: Deputy mayor in alleged conflict of interest over Tasmanian construction tender

image.altText: Close up/macro shot of bees crawling over each other inside a hive.

props.synopsis: Broome beekeeper Ryan Leavitt is devastated — and thousands of dollars out of pocket — after 960,000 bees from his hives were poisoned with insecticide.

title.children: Apiarist desperate for answers after almost a million bees deliberately poisoned in a single night

image.altText: Three women in front of Castle Hill, wearing Bring Pink to Townsville T-shirts.

props.synopsis: P!NK is preparing to take the stage in front of more than 60,000 fans in Townsville, injecting nearly $50 million into a city that struggles to attract international artists.

title.children: Townsville group's 12-year campaign to bring pop star P!NK to regional Queensland pays off

image.altText: A homeless person sleeping on a park bench in a sleeping bag.

props.synopsis: The National Rental Affordability Scheme is drawing to a close, leaving tens of thousands of renters across Australia facing an uncertain future amid a cost of living crisis and a severe shortage of private rentals.

title.children: Tenants face homelessness as affordable rental scheme ends amid expected mining bonanza budget surplus

image.altText: This photo provided by the North Korean government shows what it says is an intercontinental ballistic missile.

props.synopsis: The United Nations says it is investigating cyberattacks worth $US3 billion allegedly orchestrated by North Korea.

title.children: 'World's most prolific cyber thief': North Korea stealing cryptocurrency to fund nuclear weapons, UN report says

image.altText: a large stadium pictured from above

props.synopsis: The government insists the rebuild work will not go to waste and will now be used to inform a modest enhancement of the stadium in Brisbane's inner south.

title.children: Queensland government spent $6.4 million on now-scrapped Gabba rebuild

image.altText: A Honda SUV on fire on a suburban street.

props.synopsis: A 72-year-old man was struck on his morning walk in the Brisbane suburb of Chermside and later died in hospital.

title.children: Driver in fatal alleged hit-and-run in Brisbane went to work after allegedly setting car alight, police say

image.altText: Customers walk past an Apple logo inside of an Apple store at Grand Central Station in New York.

props.synopsis: The lawsuit accuses the tech giant of using its "walled garden" design and control of the iPhone to stifle innovation and block competitors from the smartphone market.

title.children: US launches historic lawsuit against Apple, accusing it of crushing competition

image.altText: A stack of records with artist's names such as Paul Kelly and Vance Joy

props.synopsis: Australians spent a record $676 million on music in 2023, with growth in free streaming and vinyl sales.

title.children: Sales figures show Australians are willing to buy vinyl for the artists they love
